intro: Lobelia stricklandiae, commonly known as the Hawaiian lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Molokaʻi in Hawaii. It is a herbaceous perennial that grows in moist, shaded environments, typically in forest understories. The plant features showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Lobelia stricklandiae is notable for its rarity and is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
